translated: The example of a word with both is the verbal root to smoke in the sentence smoke cooks vegetables. The two cases, the case of the object and the case of the agent, apply to the verbal root, and the suffix -t is added to the verbal root, along with the -a of the suffix -ta and the -s of the suffix -tas, making it dūṣa-s-tas. The meaning is that it is a word with both.🔽The suffixes are added later.🔽Since -t is given by -t of -t and so on, and all the rules are the same as in the section on -bhū and -ai🔽dhyai, the verbal root becomes dūṣas-tas.

original: rnam dbye tipa\ la sogs pa pha rol la yod cing aapa\ bi k'a ra na 'jig pa las byings hu la sogs pa rnams ni gnyis su 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rnam dbye tipa\ la sogs pa pha rol la yod cing aapa\ bi k'a ra na 'jig pa las byings hu la sogs pa rnams ni gnyis su 'gyur ro /
translated: The case endings tipa and so on exist for the other, but for the roots hu and so on, there is not only destruction by apibhavana, there is also another distinction.🔽The first two with vowels, and not the second,

original: ` / sa sra r'a di rdvi ra dvi: dbyangs bcas dang po gnyis te gnyis pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ` / sa sra r'a di rdvi ra dvi: dbyangs bcas dang po gnyis te gnyis pa ma yin no //
translated: are the dual of sara and so on.

original: byings gnyis su 'gyur ba de yang byings kyi dang po'i yi ge dbyangs bcas gnyis su 'gyur la yi ge gnyis pa sogs gzhan rnams ni gnyis su 'gyur ba ma yin no /
analyzed: byings gnyis su 'gyur ba de yang byings kyi dang po'i yi ge dbyangs bcas gnyis su 'gyur la yi ge gnyis pa sogs gzhan rnams ni gnyis su 'gyur ba ma yin no /
translated: That dual of the roots is the first letter of the root with vowel becoming dual, but the other second letters and so on are not dual.🔽Ku, ha, and the two of u,

analyzed: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po'i yi ge de ka sde yin na /
translated: If the first letter of the expression of the dual root is in the ka group,

original: rim pa ltar ca sder 'gyur zhing ha yin ra dzha yig tu 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rim pa ltar ca sder 'gyur zhing ha yin ra dzha yig tu 'gyur ro /
translated: it becomes the ca group and if it is ha, it becomes ra and jha respectively.

original: ` / dzha p'a n'am dza pa tsa p'a: dzha pa rnams kyi dza ba dang tsa pa'o //
analyzed: ` / dzha p'a n'am dza pa tsa p'a: dzha pa rnams kyi dza ba dang tsa pa'o //
translated: The Jhapānas and Jhapācas are the Jhapas and the Cāpas.🔽When the first letter of the two-syllable root is included in the Jhapānas, the Jhapānas are included in the Jhas and the Cāpas are included in the Chas.

original: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po'i yi ge de dzha pa so sor bsdu pa yin na dza ba so sor bsdu ba rnams dang tsa ba so sor bsdu ba rnams su 'gyur la de yang dzha pa'i nang nas dzha dha dha gha bha rnams rim pa bzhin dza
analyzed: byings gnyis brjod pa'i dang po'i yi ge de dzha pa so sor bsdu pa yin na dza ba so sor bsdu ba rnams dang tsa ba so sor bsdu ba rnams su 'gyur la de yang dzha pa'i nang nas dzha dha dha gha bha rnams rim pa bzhin dza
translated: Moreover, from among the Jhapānas, the Jhas, Dhas, Dhas, Ghas, and Bhas are respectively included in the Dhas, Dhas, Ghas, and Bhas.

original: da da ga ba rnams dang / kha pha tsha tha tha rnams rang sde'i tsa ta ta ka pa rnams su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar aapa\ bi k'a ra na sa gzung a'a na bi k'a ra na'i bar gyi rkyen de thams cad byed pa po'i rab tu bya ba'i hi don la sbyor ba yin la /
translated: Thus, all the conditions from the aṇ affix up to the āṇ affix are applied to the meaning of the agent's action.

original: rnam dbye sde tshan bzhi po de rnams la byings thams cad pa'i rnam dbye zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam dbye sde tshan bzhi po de rnams la byings thams cad pa'i rnam dbye zhes bya zhing /
translated: Those four sets of case endings are called the case endings of all nouns.

original: lhag ma 'chad 'gyur rnam dbye sde tshan drug po rnams la byings phyed pa'i rnam dbye zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma 'chad 'gyur rnam dbye sde tshan drug po rnams la byings phyed pa'i rnam dbye zhes bya ste /
translated: The remaining six sets of case endings, which will be explained, are called the case endings of half the nouns.

original: p'a ni pa'i lugs so //🔽ai ti sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'atka rta ri pra kri ya sa m'a pt'a:/
analyzed: p'a ni pa'i lugs so // ai ti sva ra sva sti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'atka rta ri pra kri ya sa m'a pt'a:/
translated: The pāṇini system.🔽iti svasti śrī vya karaṇasyāṭṭakṛtī prakṛtiḥ samāptāḥ.

original: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las byed pa po'i rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las byed pa po'i rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Thus, the agent's actions from the grammar of Sarasvatī are complete.

original: // / de nas dngos po dang las kyi rab tu byed pa rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas dngos po dang las kyi rab tu byed pa rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the nouns and actions will be explained.

original: ` a'adbhu bi karma ni /
analyzed: ` a'adbhu bi karma ni /

original: dngos po dang las la a'atra'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang las la a'atra'o //
translated: are āt for nouns and actions.

original: byings las dang bcas pa rnams la las kyi don dang las med pa rnams la dngos po'i don du rnam dbye a'atma ne pa da rnams 'jug cing dngos po'i don la de rnams kyi gcig tshig kho na 'jug la /
analyzed: byings las dang bcas pa rnams la las kyi don dang las med pa rnams la dngos po'i don du rnam dbye a'atma ne pa da rnams 'jug cing dngos po'i don la de rnams kyi gcig tshig kho na 'jug la /
translated: The case endings are used for the verbal roots that have action and for the nominal roots that do not have action.

original: nyer bsgyur gyi stobs kyis bsgyur ba la ni der ma nges so //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur gyi stobs kyis bsgyur ba la ni der ma nges so //
translated: The case endings are not definite in terms of the nominal roots that are changed by the force of the prefixes.

original: de yang byings las bcas dang las med kyi dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de yang byings las bcas dang las med kyi dbye ba ni /
translated: The verbal roots are divided into those that have action and those that do not have action.

original: byings des byed pa'i tshig gi don kho na brjod pa ni las med pa dang / las dang byed tshig gnyis ka'i don brjod pa de las dang bcas pa'i byings zhes grags pa las /
analyzed: byings des byed pa'i tshig gi don kho na brjod pa ni las med pa dang / las dang byed tshig gnyis ka'i don brjod pa de las dang bcas pa'i byings zhes grags pa las /
translated: Those verbal roots that express only the meaning of the verbal action are said to be verbal roots that do not have action. Those that express both the meaning of the verbal action and the meaning of the case ending are said to be verbal roots that have action.

original: byings las med pa ni bh'u dang / ae dha dang / a'a sa dang / sh'ing la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byings las med pa ni bh'u dang / ae dha dang / a'a sa dang / sh'ing la sogs pa ste /
translated: Verbal roots that do not have action are bhu, eḍha, ās, śiṅ, and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

original: ladzdz'a satt'a sthi ti dz'a ga ra nam briddhid ksha ya bha ya dz'i bi ta ma ram /
analyzed: ladzdz'a satt'a sthi ti dz'a ga ra nam briddhid ksha ya bha ya dz'i bi ta ma ram /
translated: Lazjā sattā sthiti jāgaranaṃ bṛddhiḥ kṣaya bhaya jīvita maraṇam.

original: sha yan kri d'a ru tsi d'i ptya rtham dh'a tu ga nam ta ma karma ka m'a hu:/
analyzed: sha yan kri d'a ru tsi d'i ptya rtham dh'a tu ga nam ta ma karma ka m'a hu:/
translated: Shayanakridarucidapatyartham dhatu ganatamakarma kamahuḥ.🔽 🔽For the sake of the play of the light of the moon, the elements, the aggregates, and karma are the great desire.🔽

original: ngo tsha yod pa gnas pa mel tshe dang // 'phel ba zad pa 'jig pa 'tsho ba dang // nyal dang rtsed mo 'od dang 'bar ba'i don //
analyzed: ngo tsha yod pa gnas pa mel tshe dang // 'phel ba zad pa 'jig pa 'tsho ba dang // nyal dang rtsed mo 'od dang 'bar ba'i don //
translated: śayan kṛt dāru ciṭa ḍi paṭya rtham dhātu ghanaṃ ta ma karma ka mahā huḥ.

original: byings kyi tshogs rnams @80b pas med par bshad do //
analyzed: byings kyi tshogs rnams @80b pas med par bshad do //
translated: The collection of nominal bases is explained to be without case endings.

original: zhes pa ste ngo tsha sogs don bcu gnyis po de rnams kyi don can gyi byings rnams la ni las med pa zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa ste ngo tsha sogs don bcu gnyis po de rnams kyi don can gyi byings rnams la ni las med pa zhes bya zhing /
translated: The nominal bases that have the meaning of the twelve cases such as the nominative are called without case endings.

original: de rnams las gzhan pa rnams las dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las gzhan pa rnams las dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Those other than those have case endings.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of things are as follows.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

original: sanm'a tram bh'a ba linggam sy'a da sprishtam yatstsha k'a ra kee: //🔽dha tv'a rtha:ke ba lam shuddhe bha ba ai tya bhi dh'i ya te /
analyzed: sanm'a tram bh'a ba linggam sy'a da sprishtam yatstsha k'a ra kee: // dha tv'a rtha:ke ba lam shuddhe bha ba ai tya bhi dh'i ya te /
translated: sanmātraṃ bhāvalingaṃ syād yac ca spṛṣṭaṃ kṛtākaraṃ.🔽dhātu-arthaḥ kevalaḥ śuddhaḥ bhāva ity abhidhīyate.

original: yod tsam dngos po'i rtags su 'gyur //
analyzed: yod tsam dngos po'i rtags su 'gyur //
translated: Mere existence is the mark of a thing.

original: gang yang byed can rnams ma reg / byings don rkyang pa dag pa ni //
analyzed: gang yang byed can rnams ma reg / byings don rkyang pa dag pa ni //
translated: Whatever is not contacted by those with action, the pure individual nominal bases,

original: de la dngos por mngon par brjod //
analyzed: de la dngos por mngon par brjod //
translated: That is the expression of the thing.

original: ces te byed can drug pa gang dang yang ma sbyar pa /🔽dngos po yod pa tsam ston pa ni dngos po'i don zhes bya'o /
analyzed: ces te byed can drug pa gang dang yang ma sbyar pa / dngos po yod pa tsam ston pa ni dngos po'i don zhes bya'o /
translated: The suffix ya is not compounded with any of the six agents.

original: ` / yaktsa turshu /
analyzed: ` / yaktsa turshu /
translated: The mere indication of the existence of a thing is called the meaning of the thing.

original: bzhi po la ya ka\'o //
analyzed: bzhi po la ya ka\'o //

analyzed: dper na / ('bras chan tshos te rang shugs kyi/) ....ao da na: pa tsya te sva ya me ba /
translated: “The rice is cooked and the water is boiling by itself.”🔽“The wood is split and the pieces are scattered by themselves.”

original: (dum bur byed do shing rang shugs kyi/) ....bhi dya te @82a * //🔽kashtham sva ya me ba /🔽(rnga bar byed do zhing rang shugs kyi/) l'u ya te ke d'a ra: sva ya me pa /🔽zhes pa lta bu ste byings patsra 'tshed pa /🔽bhi dira\ gnyis su byed pa /
analyzed: (dum bur byed do shing rang shugs kyi/) ....bhi dya te @82a * // kashtham sva ya me ba / (rnga bar byed do zhing rang shugs kyi/) l'u ya te ke d'a ra: sva ya me pa / zhes pa lta bu ste byings patsra 'tshed pa / bhi dira\ gnyis su byed pa /
translated: “The wheat is threshed and the chaff is blown away by itself.”

original: l'u nya\ gcod pa rnams la yaka\ sbyar nas bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: l'u nya\ gcod pa rnams la yaka\ sbyar nas bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The verbal roots pac “to cook,” bhid “to split,” and luñj “to thresh” are combined with the suffix -ak to form the verbs pacati, bhidyate, and luñjati.

original: yang don gcig la las kyi tshig gnyis sbyor dgos pa yang yod la /
analyzed: yang don gcig la las kyi tshig gnyis sbyor dgos pa yang yod la /
translated: There are also cases where one meaning requires the application of two verbal roots.🔽

original: de yang n'i /
analyzed: de yang n'i /
translated: There are also cases where one needs to apply two verbal roots to one meaning.🔽For example,🔽na,🔽duhi,

original: du hi / y'a tsi /
analyzed: du hi / y'a tsi /

original: ru dhi / ru tsi /
analyzed: ru dhi / ru tsi /

original: pratstshi / bhikshi /
analyzed: pratstshi / bhikshi /

original: tsinya\ sogs la las kyi tshig gnyis sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: tsinya\ sogs la las kyi tshig gnyis sbyor ba ste /
translated: and so on, where two verbal roots are applied.🔽The verbal root na,

original: n'inya\ thob pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la rkyen yaka\ sbyar /
analyzed: n'inya\ thob pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la rkyen yaka\ sbyar /
translated: means “to obtain,” to which the affix ṅi is applied.

original: de la las kyi tshig gnyis sbyar bas /
analyzed: de la las kyi tshig gnyis sbyar bas /

original: na ga ram n'i ya te n'a ga ri kee rba ne tsa ra:....(grong khyer du thob bo grong khyer bas nags spyod/) de bzhin du /🔽bru y'a tsvi slong ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la /

original: bho dza nam y'a tsya te ya dza ma no y'a tsa ke na/....(lto zas slong bar byed do slong ston gyi sar slong mo pas/) pratstsha shes par 'dod pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la /
analyzed: bho dza nam y'a tsya te ya dza ma no y'a tsa ke na/....(lto zas slong bar byed do slong ston gyi sar slong mo pas/) pratstsha shes par 'dod pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la /
translated: Pracī means “to desire to know,” to which

analyzed: (graha\ sogs kyi slar yang dag par bsgyur ba'o/) ....pritstshya te panth'a nam pa thi ke na/....(/'dri bar byed dol ma rnams lam zhugs kyis 'grul ba la/) shishye n'a tsarya sta tvam pritstshya te/....(slob mas slob dpon la de kho na nyid 'dri bar byed do/) de ltar las kyi

analyzed: tshig gnyis sbyor ba la byed pa dang 'brel pa de las gtso phal gnyis las gtso bo yin no //

analyzed: ai ti sva ra svasti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'addha ba karma / pra kri ya sa m'a pt'a:/

analyzed: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las dngos po dang las kyi rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so//

translated: If the first of the two a's of the verbal root paca and so forth is not changed to the original a-chung, that first letter is deleted and that later a-chung becomes e.

analyzed: pe tsi tha /

translated: The root yaj means “to worship a god, to assemble, to do, to give.”

analyzed: pa la ; dang po pa rasmee pa da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig napa\ sbyar gnyis kyang ngos gnyis brjod /
translated: The first one is applied to the first person singular of parasmai-pāda verbs, and the second is also expressed for both sides.

original: sngon ma'i ha sa dang po lhag po'os /
analyzed: sngon ma'i ha sa dang po lhag po'os /

original: dza\ gong ma phyis pas /
analyzed: dza\ gong ma phyis pas /

analyzed: ya yadza\/ napa\ ces gnas pa la /

original: ` na b'a doo b'urba sya /
analyzed: ` na b'a doo b'urba sya /
translated: The na of navadvīpa is removed.

original: napa\ sogs la dang po'i 'o //
analyzed: napa\ sogs la dang po'i 'o //
translated: The first of the na and so on is added.

original: napa\ la sogs pa pha rol la byings ya dza la sogs pa dang gra ha la sogs pa rnams gnyis brjod pa'i dang po de sam pra s'a ra na ste slar yang dag par bsgyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: napa\ la sogs pa pha rol la byings ya dza la sogs pa dang gra ha la sogs pa rnams gnyis brjod pa'i dang po de sam pra s'a ra na ste slar yang dag par bsgyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: The first of the parasmai-pāda roots such as yaj and the graha and so on is samprāsāraṇa, that is, it is again transformed.

original: ya dbyangs bcas aira\ bsgyur bas /
analyzed: ya dbyangs bcas aira\ bsgyur bas /
translated: The ya vowel is transformed into i.

original: ai y'a ja /
analyzed: ai y'a ja /

original: gnyis tshig la'ang de bzhin du bsgyur basa\/
analyzed: gnyis tshig la'ang de bzhin du bsgyur basa\/
translated: The same transformation is done for the dual.

original: ai yadza\/ aa tusa\ zhes gnas pa la /
analyzed: ai yadza\/ aa tusa\ zhes gnas pa la /
translated: The i and yaj remain.🔽The atus is removed.

original: ya j'am ya ba ra nam ybri ta: sam pra s'a ra nam ki ti /
analyzed: ya j'am ya ba ra nam ybri ta: sam pra s'a ra nam ki ti /
translated: ya jaṃ ya ba ra naṃ ya bṛtaḥ saṃ prasāraṇakiti.

original: ka 'gro ba la yadza rnams kyi ya bar rnams ai au ritra rnams su slar yang dag par bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: ka 'gro ba la yadza rnams kyi ya bar rnams ai au ritra rnams su slar yang dag par bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The ya of the ya class becomes i, u, and ri in the order of the ya class, and the ya of the ja class becomes i, u, and ri in the order of the ja class.

original: napa\ la sogs pa kra 'gro ba'i ming can pha rol la byings /
analyzed: napa\ la sogs pa kra 'gro ba'i ming can pha rol la byings /
translated: The na and so on of the kra class are the names of the going to the other side.

original: yadza\/ batsha\/ svapa\/ benya\/  byenya\/ hvenya / bapa\/
analyzed: yadza\/ batsha\/ svapa\/ benya\/  byenya\/ hvenya / bapa\/
translated: ya, va, sa, va, be, ve, ha ve, pa,

original: bada\ ; basa\ rnams kyi ya bar rnams ni gnyis brjod pa'i dang por ma zang gnyis pa'ang rim pa ltar ai au ri rnams su 'gyur la /
analyzed: bada\ ; basa\ rnams kyi ya bar rnams ni gnyis brjod pa'i dang por ma zang gnyis pa'ang rim pa ltar ai au ri rnams su 'gyur la /
translated: ba, da, da, the ya of the ya class becomes i, u, and ri in the order of the ya class, and the ya of the ja class becomes i, u, and ri in the order of the ja class.

original: de la sam pra s'a ra na ste slar yang dag par bsgyur ba zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de la sam pra s'a ra na ste slar yang dag par bsgyur ba zhes bya zhing /
translated: That is called saṃ prasāraṇakiti, “again perfectly transformed.”

original: sbyir slar yang dag par bsgyur ba de yang ra sogs gsal byed kho na mi 'gyur bar dbyangs bcas bsgyur ba yin la /
analyzed: sbyir slar yang dag par bsgyur ba de yang ra sogs gsal byed kho na mi 'gyur bar dbyangs bcas bsgyur ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, that “again perfectly transformed” is not only the transformation of the consonants such as ra and so on, but the transformation of the vowels along with them.

original: dbyangs de yang thung du yin na ai sogs thung du dang ring po yin na ring por bsgyur bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dbyangs de yang thung du yin na ai sogs thung du dang ring po yin na ring por bsgyur bar bya ba yin te /
translated: And that vowel, if short, is transformed into a short i and so on, and if long, it is transformed into a long i and so on.

original: ya phyi ma yang ai /
analyzed: ya phyi ma yang ai /
translated: The last ya is also ai.

original: 'dra ba'i yi ge 'dus pa sogs kyis /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i yi ge 'dus pa sogs kyis /

original: a'i dza tu: de gnyis dang 'dra bar bsgrubs pas /🔽a'i dzu:/ a'i dzi tha /
analyzed: a'i dza tu: de gnyis dang 'dra bar bsgrubs pas / a'i dzu:/ a'i dzi tha /
translated: the two are established as ai jatu.🔽The two are established as ai jzu.

original: ai ya dzi tha /🔽ai yashtha / a'i dza thu: a'i dza /
analyzed: ai ya dzi tha / ai yashtha / a'i dza thu: a'i dza /
translated: The two are established as ai jith.🔽The two are established as ai jashth.

original: ai y'a dza /🔽ai ya dza /🔽a'i dzi ba /
analyzed: ai y'a dza / ai ya dza / a'i dzi ba /
translated: The two are established as ai jathu.🔽The two are established as ai j.🔽The two are established as ai ya j.🔽The two are established as ai jiva.

original: a'i dzi ma /
analyzed: a'i dzi ma /
translated: The two are established as ai jima.

original: de bzhin du bsgrubs pas a'atma ne pa da rnams la /🔽a'i dze / a'i dz'a te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrubs pas a'atma ne pa da rnams la / a'i dze / a'i dz'a te /
translated: In the same way, the atmane pada are established.🔽The two are established as ai je.

original: a'i dzi re /🔽a'i dzi she /🔽a'i dz'a the /
analyzed: a'i dzi re / a'i dzi she / a'i dz'a the /
translated: The two are established as ai jate.🔽The two are established as ai jire.🔽The two are established as ai jash.

original: a'i dzi dhve /🔽a'i dze / a'i dzi ba he ;
analyzed: a'i dzi dhve / a'i dze / a'i dzi ba he ;
translated: The two are established as ai jathe.🔽The two are established as ai jidhve.🔽The two are established as ai je.

original: a'i dzi ma he /
analyzed: a'i dzi ma he /
translated: The two are established as ai jivahe.🔽The two are established as ai jimahe.

original: ` btsa\ yongs su brjod pa la yang pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyor ba las cho ga de dang 'dra bar bsgrubs pas /🔽au b'a tsa /🔽a'u tsa tu: a'u tsu:/
analyzed: ` btsa\ yongs su brjod pa la yang pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyor ba las cho ga de dang 'dra bar bsgrubs pas / au b'a tsa / a'u tsa tu: a'u tsu:/
translated: In the expression of the parasmai pada, by applying the same procedure,🔽the two are established as uvac.

original: au ba tsi tha /🔽a'u tsi tha /
analyzed: au ba tsi tha / a'u tsi tha /

translated: The verbal root bru becomes pa-ca for many conditions without appositional modification.

analyzed: slar yang dag par bsgyur ba dang / 'phel ba dang / yon tan sogs kyi khyad par yang med de gnyis brjod /
translated: Again, there is no correct transformation, increase, or special qualities, and so forth.

original: sngon ma'i ha sa dang po lhag po sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /🔽ba pratstsha / ba pratstsha tu: pa pratstshu: pa pratstshi tha /
analyzed: sngon ma'i ha sa dang po lhag po sogs kyis bsgrubs pas / ba pratstsha / ba pratstsha tu: pa pratstshu: pa pratstshi tha /
translated: Since the first ha sa of the previous [line] is left over,

original: pa prashtha / pa pratstsha thu: pa pratstsha /
analyzed: pa prashtha / pa pratstsha thu: pa pratstsha /
translated: it is established as ba prac cha, ba prac chatuḥ, pa prac chut, pa prac chita.🔽Pa prashtha, pa prac chatuḥ, pa prac cha.

original: pa pratstsha / pa pratstshi ba /
analyzed: pa pratstsha / pa pratstshi ba /
translated: Pa prac cha, pa prac chāva.

original: pa pratstshi ma /
analyzed: pa pratstshi ma /

original: skandhira\/ l'unya / musha\/
analyzed: skandhira\/ l'unya / musha\/

original: hrinya\ rnams la mtho 'tsham pa dang / yang yang gi don la lkog gyur gyi rnam dbye napa\ ni shis byed lot\'i skyes bu dbus ma'i gcig tshig hir bsgyur nas gcig tshig mtha' can du byed par tshig phrad kyi bsgrub par bshad de /
analyzed: hrinya\ rnams la mtho 'tsham pa dang / yang yang gi don la lkog gyur gyi rnam dbye napa\ ni shis byed lot\'i skyes bu dbus ma'i gcig tshig hir bsgyur nas gcig tshig mtha' can du byed par tshig phrad kyi bsgrub par bshad de /
translated: The suffixes ṇ and ṇya are added to the roots hṛ, to insult, and yuv, to repeat, respectively, and then the nominal affixes ṭhañ and ṭhañ are added to make them nominal stems ending in a singular.

original: byings skam dhira\ 'gro ba dang mya ngan /
analyzed: byings skam dhira\ 'gro ba dang mya ngan /
translated: The roots skam, to go, and dhi, to grieve,

original: l'unya\ gcod pa /
analyzed: l'unya\ gcod pa /

original: musha\ brku ba /
analyzed: musha\ brku ba /

original: hrinya\ 'phrog pa rnams la /
analyzed: hrinya\ 'phrog pa rnams la /

original: napa\ de hi ru bsgyur /🔽skam dhi ra dang / hrinya gnyis la aapa\ bi k'a ra na /
analyzed: napa\ de hi ru bsgyur / skam dhi ra dang / hrinya gnyis la aapa\ bi k'a ra na /
translated: are changed to hi🔽and then the nominal affixes ṭhañ and ṭhañ are added.

original: l'unya la n'a bi k'a ra na /
analyzed: l'unya la n'a bi k'a ra na /
translated: The roots skam and dhi and the two roots hṛ and ṇya are changed to skand, lūnya to lūna, and muṣ to muṣa.

original: musha\ la a'a na bi k'a ra na rnams sbyor ba sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /🔽skandha / l'u n'i hi /🔽mu sh'a na /
analyzed: musha\ la a'a na bi k'a ra na rnams sbyor ba sogs kyis bsgrubs pas / skandha / l'u n'i hi / mu sh'a na /
translated: The nominal affixes ṭhañ and ṭhañ are added to them.

original: ha ra zhes pa rnams 'grub ste /
analyzed: ha ra zhes pa rnams 'grub ste /
translated: The nominal stems skand, lūna, muṣa, and hṛ are formed.

original: nye ba'i tshig dad sbyar ba'i dpe ni ji skad du /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig dad sbyar ba'i dpe ni ji skad du /
translated: An example of the application of the nominal affixes is as follows.

original: p'u r'i ma baskandha l'u n'i hinanda nam mu sh'a na ratn'a ni ha r'a ma r'am ga n'a:/
analyzed: p'u r'i ma baskandha l'u n'i hinanda nam mu sh'a na ratn'a ni ha r'a ma r'am ga n'a:/
translated: The nominal stem pūrvaskandhalūnaihīnanamūṣanaratnāni harāmy aham gacchāmi.

original: bi gri hya tsa kre na mu tsidvi sh'a b'a sh'i ya aittha mashts'asthya ma harni sham di ba:/
analyzed: bi gri hya tsa kre na mu tsidvi sh'a b'a sh'i ya aittha mashts'asthya ma harni sham di ba:/
translated: Vṛddhi-yaccha-kṛṇe namucit dviṣā vāśīya ittha-maścāsthya maharṣi-śaṃḍaḥ.

original: grong khyer mya ngan med bcom dga' ba'i tshal rnams bcad //
analyzed: grong khyer mya ngan med bcom dga' ba'i tshal rnams bcad //
translated: The city of Aśoka is destroyed, the Nandana groves are cut down,

original: rin chen rnams brkus 'chi med yan lag ma rnams phrogs //
analyzed: rin chen rnams brkus 'chi med yan lag ma rnams phrogs //
translated: The jewels are stolen, the Aśvinī-limbs are abducted,

original: rnam 'khrugs 'khor los 'thor ba'i 'tshe bas khyab par ni //
analyzed: rnam 'khrugs 'khor los 'thor ba'i 'tshe bas khyab par ni //
translated: The wheel of destruction, agitated, spreads out with violence.

original: ngal ba med par gnod byed 'di 'dra gnas pa min //
analyzed: ngal ba med par gnod byed 'di 'dra gnas pa min //
translated: But this kind of harm does not remain without effort.🔽 Thus, these words beginning with pra are mostly used for the distant past that has long passed, and they also have various meanings.

original: de ltar napra la sogs pa 'di rnams gtso bor lkog tu gyur ba'i dus 'das nas yun ring song ba la 'jug pa shas che zhing gzhan yang don sna tshogs pa la 'jug go / ai ti sva ra svasti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'atpa ronyaksha pa
analyzed: de ltar napra la sogs pa 'di rnams gtso bor lkog tu gyur ba'i dus 'das nas yun ring song ba la 'jug pa shas che zhing gzhan yang don sna tshogs pa la 'jug go / ai ti sva ra svasti by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'atpa ronyaksha pa

original: kri ya sa m'apt'a: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las lkog gyur gyi rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: kri ya sa m'apt'a: zhes pa brda sprod pa dbyangs can gyi mdo las lkog gyur gyi rab tu byed pa rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Thus ends the section on the obscure in the Sutra of Sarasvatī's Grammar.

original: // / de nas smon pa'i don gyi rnam dbye rnams kyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas smon pa'i don gyi rnam dbye rnams kyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the rites of the various meanings of the optative will be explained.

original: a'a shi shi y'a dy'ast'am y'a su sy'a sy'a stam y'asta y'a sam y'a sva y'asma s'ishta s'i y'ast'am s'i ram s'ishthass'i @89b y'asth'am s'i dhvam s'i ya s'i ba his'i ma hi /
analyzed: a'a shi shi y'a dy'ast'am y'a su sy'a sy'a stam y'asta y'a sam y'a sva y'asma s'ishta s'i y'ast'am s'i ram s'ishthass'i @89b y'asth'am s'i dhvam s'i ya s'i ba his'i ma hi /
translated: āśiṣya ādyas tāṃ yās tāyās saṃyās svayāsmiṣṭasīyās tāṃ sītaraṃ sītathās tāṃ sthāṃ sītvaṃ sītāya sībhiḥ sāmāhi.

original: smon par byed pa la /🔽y'atra / y'ast'am /🔽y'a susa\/ y'asa\/ y'astam /
analyzed: smon par byed pa la / y'atra / y'ast'am / y'a susa\/ y'asa\/ y'astam /

original: y'asta / y'a sam /🔽y'a sva / y'asma /
analyzed: y'asta / y'a sam / y'a sva / y'asma /
translated: yās tu, yās taṃ,🔽yās taṃ, yās taṃ,

original: ` s'ishta / s'i yast'am /🔽s'i rana\/ s'ishth'asa\/ s'i y'asth'am /
analyzed: ` s'ishta / s'i yast'am / s'i rana\/ s'ishth'asa\/ s'i y'asth'am /

original: s'i dhvam / s'i ya /🔽s'i ba hi /
analyzed: s'i dhvam / s'i ya / s'i ba hi /

original: s'i ma hi rnams so //
analyzed: s'i ma hi rnams so //

original: byings las smon par byed pa'i don gyi bya ba brjod pa la y'ata la sogs pa 'di rnams 'jug cing rnam dbye 'di rnams kyi'ang dang po dgu pa rasmee pa da ste ka 'gro ba'i ming can dang / phyi ma dgu a'atma ne pa da ste pa 'gro ba'i ming can zhes tha snyad byed la /
analyzed: byings las smon par byed pa'i don gyi bya ba brjod pa la y'ata la sogs pa 'di rnams 'jug cing rnam dbye 'di rnams kyi'ang dang po dgu pa rasmee pa da ste ka 'gro ba'i ming can dang / phyi ma dgu a'atma ne pa da ste pa 'gro ba'i ming can zhes tha snyad byed la /
translated: In the case of the verbal root, the meaning of which is to desire, these yat, etc., are used to express the action of the verb, and the first of these case endings is called raspadi, which means “having the name of ka, which is the name of the verbal root,” and the last is called atmani-pada, which means “having the name of pa, which is the name of the case ending.”

original: p'a ni pa'i lugs la smon pa'i ling zhes zer ro //
analyzed: p'a ni pa'i lugs la smon pa'i ling zhes zer ro //
translated: In the system of Pa, it is called “the case ending of desire.”

original: de ltar na byings bh'u yod pa la pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar bas /
analyzed: de ltar na byings bh'u yod pa la pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar bas /
translated: Thus, the verbal root bhu, which means “to exist,” is combined with the raspadi case endings:🔽bhuyat, bhusatām,

original: bh'u y'atra / bh'u y'ast'am /🔽bh'u y'a su:/ bh'u y'a:/
analyzed: bh'u y'atra / bh'u y'ast'am / bh'u y'a su:/ bh'u y'a:/

original: bh'u y'astam / bh'u y'asta /
analyzed: bh'u y'astam / bh'u y'asta /

original: bh'u y'a sam /
analyzed: bh'u y'a sam /

original: bh'u y'a sva /
analyzed: bh'u y'a sva /

original: bh'u y'asma / nye ba'i tshig dang sbyar ba'i dpe ni /
analyzed: bh'u y'asma / nye ba'i tshig dang sbyar ba'i dpe ni /
translated: An example of the application of the near-synonyms is:🔽śrīmān bhuyat “May he be glorious.”

original: sa: shr'i m'anra bh'u y'atra/....(de dpal dang ldan par gyur cig/) de bzhin du dz'i ba srog 'tsho ba la'o zhes pa la pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar bas /
analyzed: sa: shr'i m'anra bh'u y'atra/....(de dpal dang ldan par gyur cig/) de bzhin du dz'i ba srog 'tsho ba la'o zhes pa la pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar bas /

original: ` dz'i by'atra /🔽dz'i by'ast'am / dz'i by'a su:/🔽sogs te nye ba'i tshig dang sbyar ba'i dpe ni /🔽sha tam sha ra de dz'i by'adbha bana\/....(khyod ston brgya 'tsho bar shog/) ` byings batsa\ smra ba la pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar /
analyzed: ` dz'i by'atra / dz'i by'ast'am / dz'i by'a su:/ sogs te nye ba'i tshig dang sbyar ba'i dpe ni / sha tam sha ra de dz'i by'adbha bana\/....(khyod ston brgya 'tsho bar shog/) ` byings batsa\ smra ba la pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar /
translated: `jaivayatram🔽jaivayastham🔽jaivayasusukham🔽and so forth.🔽The example of applying the near word is:🔽śatam śaradāṃ jīvatām🔽(May you live for a hundred autumns.)🔽The verbal root is applied with parasmād, padam, etc.

original: kranga\ 'gro ba sogs kyis sam pra s'a ra nar bsgyur bas /
analyzed: kranga\ 'gro ba sogs kyis sam pra s'a ra nar bsgyur bas /
